remarks.para: This is a file modifying operation, hence it is journalized. Journalized file operations can either be rolled back or committed automatically, restoring or removing the backupped file(s), respectively. Whenever any type occurs all journalized operations are rolled back, otherwise they are all committed.
By creating the instance of inside the , the journal providing the rollback functionality becomes active, resulting in data integrity to be preserved.

Creating the instance of outside the , results in the journal providing the rollback functionality not being used. In this case the instance will function as the regular implementation instance it wraps.
